guide.introduction:
Flowers aren't the only way to add a pop of color to otherwise plain-Jane vases. With just a bit of yarn and an evening in front of the TV, you can whip up a craftier solution! These vase sleeves are worked up in the current pattern-craze du jour (see my Ode-to Missoni Blanket): the chevron stitch. Make them in your favorite colors, then change 'em out to fit the season... or your mood!

Project originally posted on CRAFT.

Relevant parts
  • Yarn
  • Vase
Tools
  • Knitting needles
  • Tapestry needle

parts.notes: I used Stitch.Rock.Love Sheep(ish) for Caron, 30% wool, 70% acrylic in colors: (A) Yellow(ish), (C) Lime(ish) (D) Pumpkin(ish), (E) Robin's Egg(ish), (F) Olive(ish), plus small amount of (B) White(ish)
I got mine as a set from Ikea.

lines.text: Row 1 (RS): K1, K2tog, *K4, dbl inc, K4, dbl dec; rep from * to last 3 sts, k2togtbl, K1.
lines.text_raw: Row 1 (RS): K1, K2tog, *K4, dbl inc, K4, dbl dec; rep from * to last 3 sts, k2togtbl, K1.

lines.text: You can play with the stripe placement as you like, or follow my choices as a guide.
lines.text_raw: You can play with the stripe placement as you like, or follow my choices as a guide.

lines.text: Always change colors on a RS row!
lines.text_raw: Always change colors on a RS row!

lines.text: Work in Chevron Stitch Pattern until piece measures 1 1/2" shorter than the vase, at top point of chevron.
lines.text_raw: Work in Chevron Stitch Pattern until piece measures 1 1/2" shorter than the vase, at top point of chevron.

lines.text: Vase 2 pattern: Two-row stripes, using colors C and E.
lines.text_raw: Vase 2 pattern: Two-row stripes, using colors C and E.

lines.text: BO, leaving a long tail for seaming. Weave in ends. Wrap piece around the vase and seam shut.
